title: Check out the Bruins’ throwback uniforms for the 2016 Winter Classic - Bruins
text:
The Boston Bruins will be sporting a vintage look for the 2016 Winter Classic.
The team unveiled the uniforms it will be wearing at Gillette Stadium on Jan. 1, 2016 when hosting the rival Montreal Canadiens during an event for season ticket holders on Saturday.
Bruins unveiled their Winter Classic uniform. Read details here: https://t.co/VM3SmTb85A ^BB pic.twitter.com/4b0wCBhXdt
— Boston Bruins (@NHLBruins) October 24, 2015 Advertisement - Continue Reading Below According to the Bruins, their 2016 Winter Classic uniforms are inspired by the franchise’s 1924 apparel.
The inspiration for the design of the full uniform and the crest generally came from the first uniform ever worn by the Bruins during their inaugural season in 1924, under legendary coach Art Ross.
The striping pattern recalls this original uniform, but has been updated in the Bruins current identity colors of Black & Gold, connecting the past and current Bruins color identity.
